contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Sunagawa |JapaneseName= 砂川 |settlement_type= [[Cities of Japan|City]] |MapImage= Sunagawa in Hokkaido Prefecture Ja.svg |MapCaption= Location of Sorachi in Hokkaido |Region= [[Hokkaido]] |Prefecture= [[Hokkaido]] ([[Sorachi Subprefecture|Sorachi]]) |District= |Area_km2= 78.69 |PopDate= June 30, 2008 |Population= 19,556 |Density_km2= 249 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 43 |LatitudeMinutes= 30 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 141 |LongtitudeMinutes= 54 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= [[Sorbus commixta|Japanese Rowan]] |Flower= [[Lily of the Valley]] |Bird= |SymbolImage=Sunagawa Hokkaido chapter.svg |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= Katsutoshi Kikuya |CityHallPostalCode= 073-0195 |CityHallAddress= 1-1 Kita San-chōme, Nishi Roku-jō, Sunagawa-shi, Hokkaido |CityHallPhone= 0125-54-2121 |CityHallLink= {{URL|www.city.sunagawa.hokkaido.jp}} }} {{nihongo|'''Sunagawa'''|砂川市|Sunagawa-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Sorachi Subprefecture]], [[Hokkaido]], Japan. As of 2008, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 19,556 and a [[population density]] of 249 persons per km². The total area is 78.69 km². The city was founded on July 1, 1958. == History == *1890 Nae Village founded *1895 Nae Village Office opened *1897 [[Utashinai, Hokkaidō|Utashinai]] Village splits off *1902 Nae becomes a Second Class Municipality *1903 Nae Village becomes Sunagawa Village *1907 Sunagawa becomes a First Class Municipality *1923 Sunagawa Village becomes Sunagawa Town *1944 [[Naie, Hokkaidō|Naie]] Village splits off *1949 [[Kamisunagawa, Hokkaidō|Kamisunagawa]] Town splits off *July 1, 1958 Sunagawa Town becomes Sunagawa City ==External links== {{commons category|Sunagawa, Hokkaido|Sunagawa, Hokkaidō}} * {{Official website|http://www.city.sunagawa.hokkaido.jp}} {{ja icon}} {{Hokkaido}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sunagawa, Hokkaido}} [[Category:Cities in Hokkaido]] {{Hokkaido-geo-stub}}
